riddles.riddle: I spun round and round while playing your favorite songs. You placed a needle on me gently. What am I?
riddles.hint: Think vinyl...

riddles.riddle: I have keys but open no doors. Each press leaves an inked letter behind. A bell rings when you reach the end of a line. What am I?
riddles.hint: Writers used me before computers.

riddles.riddle: I have a dial with numbers and a curly cord. You had to spin my wheel and wait for each number to return. What am I?
riddles.hint: You couldn't push my buttons — I didn't have any.

riddles.riddle: On warm summer nights, you'd park your car and watch movies on a giant screen under the stars. What am I?
riddles.hint: You never had to leave your car.

riddles.riddle: I was small enough to fit in your pocket and brought music and news through a tiny speaker. I ran on batteries and had a dial to find stations. What am I?
riddles.hint: A portable way to tune in.

riddles.riddle: Drop a coin in me, pick your favorite song, and I'll play it for the whole diner to hear. What am I?
riddles.hint: I was usually found in restaurants and soda shops.

riddles.riddle: I had four wheels, one on each corner, and you strapped me onto your shoes to glide down the sidewalk. What am I?
riddles.hint: There were rinks dedicated to using me.

riddles.riddle: Point me, click, and in a minute a white square slides out. Shake it gently and watch the image slowly appear. What am I?
riddles.hint: Instant photography, no darkroom needed.

riddles.riddle: I held your music on a ribbon of tape. You could flip me over for more songs, but sometimes I'd get tangled. A pencil could fix me. What am I?
riddles.hint: You'd rewind me with a pencil to save batteries.

riddles.riddle: I sat on your roof and caught invisible signals from the sky. You'd have to adjust me to get a clear picture on your television. What am I?
riddles.hint: Sometimes called rabbit ears when I was indoors.

riddles.riddle: I'm a lamp filled with colorful goo that slowly rises and falls in mesmerizing blobs. I was the grooviest decoration of the 1960s. What am I?
riddles.hint: I was a psychedelic centerpiece.

riddles.riddle: Wear me on your finger and I'll change colors based on your emotions — or so they said. What am I?
riddles.hint: I was a 1970s jewelry sensation.

riddles.riddle: Stand on me, bounce up and down, and try not to fall off! I have a spring and two foot pegs. What am I?
riddles.hint: A bouncy toy for the backyard.

riddles.riddle: Swing me around your waist and try to keep me spinning. I was a 1950s craze that got the whole nation twirling. What am I?
riddles.hint: Wham-O made millions of me.

riddles.riddle: Hold me up to your eyes, pull the lever, and see a 3D picture on a little cardboard disc. What am I?
riddles.hint: I showed stereoscopic images on round reels.

riddles.riddle: I was bigger than a cassette and held your music on a continuous loop of tape in a chunky cartridge. I often got stuck in the player. What am I?
riddles.hint: Popular in cars during the 1970s.

riddles.riddle: Sit on a spinning stool at my counter and order a milkshake, an egg cream, or a cherry phosphate. What am I?
riddles.hint: Often found inside a drugstore.

riddles.riddle: For just a cent, you could pick me from a jar — a root beer barrel, a Mary Jane, or a piece of taffy. What am I?
riddles.hint: The cheapest treat at the corner store.

riddles.riddle: Every morning, I'd appear on your doorstep in glass bottles. You'd leave the empty ones out for me to take back. What am I?
riddles.hint: A milkman brought me to your home.

riddles.riddle: I was the family car with wood-paneled sides, a long body, and a big back for kids and luggage. What am I?
riddles.hint: The ultimate family road trip vehicle.
